title: WSJ Wealth Adviser Briefing: Crazy Year in Investing, Office Parties Still On — and Awkward, RV Parking
sub_head: Curated news and analysis for wealth advisers and their clients from WSJ reporters and columnists
body:
It takes three to tango -- at least it does in the case of a new robo-advisor.
U.S. asset manager Franklin Templeton has teamed up with Singapore-based wealthtech Bambu, and Apex Clearing to launch Tango, a new digital wealth management system.
The partners are not aiming this robo directly at retail investors. Instead, they’ve designed it to help human financial advisors serve their clients. It adds to the white-label robo options -- which also include services like Betterment for Advisors -- available to advisory firms.
Below, some of the best analysis and insight from WSJ writers and columnists, the Dow Jones Newswires team and occasionally beyond, on investing, the wealth-management business and more.
CORONAVIRUS OUTLOOK
